title: The food gone bad.
event: [EVENT_s] planning [EVENT_sep] looking [EVENT_sep] went [EVENT_sep] realized gone [EVENT_sep] threw food out [EVENT_e]
text: Lisa was planning on eating leftovers for lunch. All morning she was looking forward to her food. At lunch time she went to get the food. She realized that it had all gone bad. She reluctantly threw the food out.

text: I went to play tennis with a lot of friends. When we were outside we saw the ice cream truck. I jumped for joy. I hadn't seen one in years. I immediately ran to order something.

title: Distant Friend

text: It was the last day of school. Kate wanted to spend the night at her friend Sue's. But Sue was spending the summer with her grandma in Maine. Jane realized they wouldn't see each other for months. The girls stood hugging each other and crying.

title: Tardy to Ballet
event: [EVENT_s] loved going [EVENT_sep] made sure [EVENT_sep] was [EVENT_sep] got was [EVENT_sep] learned lesson [EVENT_e]
text: Sarah loved going to ballet class every week. Her parents always made sure she was there on time. One week there was a traffic jam and she knew she wouldn't make it. By the time Sarah got there class was almost over. She and her parents learned their lesson to leave earlier for ballet.
leading_context: Sarah loved going to ballet class every week.

text: Jack was a rookie on his baseball team. He had little experience but was eager. One game other players got injured and he got more play time. Jack did very well and impressed everyone. He was given more play time from then on out.
